channel.title: Need help
channel.description:
im gonna rephrase the question i asked in another topic......
[code]Item3.java:32: <identifier> expected Item3.randomBones(); ^ [/code]
anyone know how to fix this error? also would someone teach me what a identifier is......and how it works and ect......? ***plz no useless posts plz***

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @Haxor_X Haxor X
item.description:
@Haxor_X wrote:

what would be a reasonable number so that the exp isn’t so fast that you max everything with no effort
but then its easy enough to not take years…
also how to make it so your char atks faster without having to click like a million times…

EDIT:
Brandon your tut does not work i changed all the numbers yet exp is still the same…
i hit a 1 on a monkey still only got 4 exp…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

Brendan, my counter isn’t working, added everything…
Here is the void for it

public void CharCount(){
}
	if (char == 0) {
	showInterface(3559);
	}
	char == 1;
	} else if (char == 1) {
	closeInterface();
	}
}

That should work - added the char token everywhere, added the int… what the hell.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Purpose : To answer you’re question (5 Minute tut ftw)

Difficulty : 1/10

Assumed Knowledge : Searching blah-blah-blah…

Server Base : Any

Classes Modified : client.java

Procedure
Step 1 - Attack : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 823:

You should see something like this below it if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You Attack The Dummy."); setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18); actionTimer = 12; } break;

To change the experience gained just change the 150, 300 and the other 150.

Step 2 - Strength : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 1531:

Below that you should see something like this if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You start hitting the door"); actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[2]), 2); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

To change the experience ganied again, change the 150 and the 300.

Step 3 - Defence : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 299:

You should see something like this below it [code]if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0)
{
sendMessage(“You Dig In The Stack And Get Xp!”);
addSkillXP((150playerLevel[1]), 1);
addSkillXP((150playerLevel[18]), 18);
actionTimer = 20;
setAnimation(0x320);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
}
break;

Again, change the 2 150’s to alter the experience gained.[/code]

Step 4 - Magic : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for Varrock

Until you see something like this below it [code] {
teleX = 3489;
teleY = 3288;
addSkillXP((20*playerLevel[6]), 6);
newheightLevel = 0;
}

 if (s == "Falador")
 {
    teleX = 2964;
    teleY = 3378;
    addSkillXP((30*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
         
 }

 if (s == "Lumby")
 {
    teleX = 3222;
    teleY = 3218;
    addSkillXP((40*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

 if (s == "Camelot")
 {
    teleX = 2757;
    teleY = 3477;
   addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

 if (s == "Ardougne")
 {
    teleX = 2662;
    teleY = 3305;
    addSkillXP((120*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
    
 }

 if (s == "Watchtower")
 {
    teleX = 2549;
    teleY = 3113;
    addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
    
 }

 if (s == "Trollheim")
 {
    teleX = 2480;
    teleY = 5174;
    addSkillXP((400*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

 if (s == "Ape")
 {
    teleX = 2761;
    teleY = 2784;
    addSkillXP((400*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 1;
 }
if (s == "Paddewwa"){

    teleX = 3131; 
    teleY = 9912;
    addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Senntisten”){

    teleX = 3312; 
    teleY = 3376;
    addSkillXP((200*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Kharyrll”){

    teleX = 3493; 
    teleY = 3485;
    addSkillXP((25*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }
if (s == "Lasaar"){

    teleX = 3007; 
    teleY = 3477;
    addSkillXP((350*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }
if (s == "Carrallangar"){

    teleX = 3161; 
    teleY = 3671;
    addSkillXP((400*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Annakarl”){

    teleX = 3288; 
    teleY = 3886;
    addSkillXP((550*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Ghorrock”){

    teleX = 3091;
    teleY = 3963;
    addSkillXP((650*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }[/code]

To change the experience gained by teleporting each time, change all the numbers with *'s next to them.

Step 5 - Range : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 2514:

You should see something like this below it if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You shoot at the target."); actionName = "range1"; actionTimer = 30; setAnimation(426); addSkillXP((7*playerLevel[4]), 4); addSkillXP((5*playerLevel[18]), 18); addItem(3272, 1); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;

Again, change the numbers with the *'s beside them to change the Range experience gained.

Credits : ME ME ME

That’s how to modify the experience rates in you’re server.

Newb, what the guy done was, he made an “if” statement, saying that if the character had certain looks when they logged in, the interface would show up, (basically forcing them to change their character into something more unique) but after that it wouldn’t show.

Do you understand me?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Search this in npc.CFG;

Black_dragon

You should see something like this;

npc = 54	Black_dragon			227	5000

Change the 5000 to whatever you wan’t the HP to be. The max a HP bar can hold is 250, so when you’ve depleted 250 HP from an NPC, the bar will re-fill, adding on another 250 HP according to whatever HP you set in npc.CFG.

[quote=“Newb 2341, post:12, topic:96679”][quote author=I Br3ndan I link=topic=139334.msg1342392#msg1342392 date=1179610528]

No, that is needed for randoms…
And I’m a guy!

No it’s not actually.
[/quote]

The damn random means random.
Don’t talk.

Haxor, go to npc.cfg, find the ID, change the second number to like 400 or something - it’s the health.[/quote]

Strange. In my server it works fine without the ‘random’ part.
